reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights as we were attending a wedding which was about 25 minutes drive away. Whilst there were country hotels nearer to the wedding venue our choice was largely dictated by the fact I needed three rooms for my family, including my son and his partner who were travelling up from London by train. So we plumped for here on the basis it offered a good compromise- about half the price of a country hotel, close to the station and easy access to major roads but in a new town centre that has no charm whatsoever. The rooms were clean and spacious and the beds comfortable. Breakfast was okay and the service perfectly friendly. The car park is small but you can use, for £3 per day, the multi storey next door. Harlow is a dump (apologies to all who live there!) and the hotel is located next to the jobcentre, a police station and a car park - that is not a romantic location! However, as a place to sleep that is clean it is fine.
reviews.title: You don't go to Harlow for your holiday!

reviews.text: Stayed here on a business trip, hotel is fairly new and I was expecting it to be clean but this was exceptional The room was modern and well fitted, for the money it was fantastic.
reviews.title: Fresh and new, friendly staff and very accomodating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only slight downside is the size of the car park, but if you go on a motorbike there is loads of room!
reviews.title: good value, excellent hotel

reviews.text: I would definitely stay at this hotel again, for business or pleasure.
reviews.title: Just the job

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a new hotel and they have done a really good job on it, the rooms are spacious and furnished to a high standard for this type of hotel and the bathroom has a massive shower, the micron let's it down a bit but it fiddling work to a degree.
reviews.title: WOW
Great hotel in centre of town
reviews.text: I stayed here to visit my relatives. The hotel is very new. Clean and smells great. Staff very friendly, room large and comfortable, everything you need. Not too noisy. Parking available too (not that I needed it), easy reach of London. Shops on doorstep. Breakfast good. Book in advance. I would definitely go back.

reviews.title: Clean, new, great shower - All you need except free wireless.
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel this weekend, getting a special price of £39.00 with breakfast included. We arrived in the afternoon and took the last spot in the very very small car park and in we went. reception is clean, bright and airy, the staff were polite and helpful and check in took less than 5 minutes. Our room was on the first floor, it was immaculate with a comfy large bed, big shower and digital TV. Only drawback is the wireless internet is exorbitantly priced at £8.95 for 24 hours access. This is a complete rip off!

reviews.title: Good place to stay, smart & clean, good value
reviews.text: Breakfast in the morning was plentiful with sausage, eggs and beans along with toast, muffins, croissants, rolls, cereals and fruit. I had no complaints and again it was all kept topped up and fresh.

reviews.title: Central Harlow
reviews.text: All in all I would thoroughly recommend this hotel, especially if they make the wireless internet freefree.

reviews.title: New hotel-good decor-beware of the sausages!!
reviews.text: Stayed here with the family as a planned stop-over whilst heading north. It is situated in a handy position not far from the M11 (5 minutes).

reviews.title: Quiet But Central
reviews.text: This is a fairly new hotel I would imagine, everything was very clean & new.

reviews.title: Nice hotel in a central location.
reviews.text: Staff very helpful, although car park is tiny. We were there for an event in evening & we got a taxi right outside, it was reasonable & not worth the trying to get the car out of the car park & not be able to park when we returned.

reviews.title: Great value
reviews.text: My only criticism would be take your own t bags as the ones in room & at breakfast were so weak was like drinking milkie water. But lovely breakfast.

reviews.title: Don't book through the hotel
reviews.text: We booked the Holiday Inn as it was only 7 miles from an event that we were attending with our grandson the following day, so it was a prefect base for us.

reviews.title: Great hotel shame about harlow itself!
reviews.text: The hotel is right in the middle of Harlow, next to the bus station, but by the time we arrived late in the evening, the area was nice and quiet. Perfect. Taxi's run right outside the hotel if you need them.

I have always been sceptical of Holiday Inn Express, the pictures of somewhat dated rooms on trip advisor for the chain's other hotels have made me wary of staying there. However, when visiting Harlow recently I decided to give them a try - and I am very glad I did.
reviews.title: Brilliant! Good Value, would stay again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is clearly a fairly new hotel and the service received on checking in was the friendliest I had received during my week of travelling. I was immediately impressed with my room on entering, a modern, clean and tidy room with a nice bed, handy sofa, good sized desk, tv, air conditioning, choice of firm or soft pillows and a spotless bathroom with a good shower. Everything I needed to relax after a long trip and for a good price too.
reviews.title: Good staff, location and price, uncomfortable bed and awful breakfast
Budget stay for budget way
reviews.text: Next day the breakfast was totally self service from a well stocked buffet - which frankly is exactly what I need in the mornings, no one fussing asking me if I want coffee when I can get it all myself or trying to show me to a table, I could sit where I wanted in the bright and airy restaurant/breakfast room. The only thing I would suggest is that they put the trays somewhere more easy to find.

reviews.title: Raise in standard welcome
reviews.text: There was a car park on site that seemed to have spare places but I had walked from the station on this trip. The hotel is located in the town centre but I was not bothered by noise from the outside during my stay.
I will stay here again if I am in Harlow.
reviews.title: Outstanding stay
